title: NASC-seq (new transcriptome alkylation-dependent single-cell RNA sequencing) protocol
title_html: NASC-seq (new transcriptome alkylation-dependent single-cell RNA sequencing) protocol

authors.name: Michael Lidschreiber
authors.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for Biophysical Chemistry & Karolinska Institute Stockholm

authors.name: Katja Lidschreiber
authors.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for Biophysical Chemistry & Karolinska Institute Stockholm

authors.name: Patrick Cramer
authors.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for Biophysical Chemistry & Karolinska Institute Stockholm

source.description:
Prepare the following lysis buffer on ice.
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Sodium Phosphate buffer (200mM)2.5 μl264 μl
3RNAse inhibitor0.2 μl21.12 μl
4ERCC + 4sU Spike-in mix0.1 μl10.56 μl
5Nuclease-free water0.2 μl21.12 μl
6Total3 μl316.8 μl

ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Sodium Phosphate buffer (200mM)2.5 μl264 μl
3RNAse inhibitor0.2 μl21.12 μl
4ERCC + 4sU Spike-in mix0.1 μl10.56 μl
5Nuclease-free water0.2 μl21.12 μl
6Total3 μl316.8 μl
Distribute 3 μl of freshly prepared lysis buffer to each well of a 96-well PCR plate using a multichannel or high-throughput liquid dispensing system.
Distribute single cells into each well of the lysis plate by FACS sorting.

source.body: Seal the plates with aluminium foil seal and store at -80°C.

source.title: Keep cells and lysis plate cooled before, during and after sorting.

source.description: Transfer 60 μl Dynabeads to a clean eppendorf tube (for a 96-well plate).

source.body:
Dynabeads sediment with time and need to be vortexed well before pipetting.
Do not use DNA-low-bind consumables since dynabeads may stick to the tips and tubes

source.description:
Prepare the alkylation mix at room temperature.
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2DMSO4.5 μl517.5 μl
3Iodoacetamide (200mM, in DMSO)0.5 μl57.5 μl
4Total5 μl575 μl

ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2DMSO4.5 μl517.5 μl
3Iodoacetamide (200mM, in DMSO)0.5 μl57.5 μl
4Total5 μl575 μl

source.body: To avoid problems with iodocatamide stability and variability of alkylating potential, we use single-use aliquots of iodoacetamide that are dissolved in DMSO at 200mM right before they are used to prepare the alkylation mix above and the remainder is discarded.
Iodoacetamide should be handled in a fume hood and in accordence with local environmental health and safety regulations.

source.description: Remove the supernatant from each well carefully while the plate is on the magnet. Avoid touching the beads. Immediately after pipetting off the supernatant in a column of wells, add 10 ul of Reverse Transcription mix to those wells.

source.body: Iodoacetamide should be handled in a fume hood and in accordence with local environmental health and safety regulations.
Avoid touching the beads while pipetting the supernatant off, and pipette the Reverse Transcription mix to the side where the beads are immobilized to avoid drying out the beads.

source.description: Remove the lysis plate from -80°C and thaw on ice.

source.body: If proceeding directly from FACS sorting the cells to the prepration of the NASC-seq libraries, it is recommended to freeze the cells at -80°C for 5 minutes and continue with step 5 to ensure that the cells are completely lysed.

source.description: Place the lysis plate in a thermocycler and denature the RNA at 80°C for 3 minutes.
Distribute 2ul of beads to each well of the lysis plate.
Incubate the beads for 20 minutes at room temperature with agitation.

Spin the plate down genlty and place on the magnet.
Pipette 10 μl of STOP mix to each well of the plate while the plate is on the magnet.

source.body: Iodoacetamide should be handled in a fume hood and in accordence with local environmental health and safety regulations.

source.description: Spin the plate down gently and place back on the magnet and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.

source.body: Iodoacetamide should be handled in a fume hood and in accordence with local environmental health and safety regulations.

source.description:
Add 5 μl of the alkylation mix to each well of the sample plate, spin gently, and incubate with agitation at 50°C for 15 minutes.
While the alklylation reaction is running, prepare the STOP mix:
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Superscript II RT buffer4.0 μl460 μl
3Nuclease-free water5.10 μl586.50 μl
4Tween 20 (10%)0.3 μl34.50 μl
5DTT (1M)0.6 μl69.00 μl
6Total10 μl1150 μl
While the alkylation reaction is running, prepare the reverse transcription mix (see step 14)

ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Superscript II RT buffer4.0 μl460 μl
3Nuclease-free water5.10 μl586.50 μl
4Tween 20 (10%)0.3 μl34.50 μl
5DTT (1M)0.6 μl69.00 μl
6Total10 μl1150 μl

Optional: Store lysis plate.
Seal plate with aluminium foil and store at -80°C, if not immediately continuing with step 4.
Add 12 μl of the PCR mix to each well of the plate with the reverse transcribed cDNA.
Add 18 μl AMPure XP beads to each well of the amplified cDNA libraries and mix by pipetting up and down. Incubate for 15 minutes at room temperature.

Prepare the reverse transcription mix:
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Superscript II Reverse Transcriptase0.5 μl55.2 μl
3Superscript II RT buffer2 μl220.8 μl
4RNAse inhibitor0.2 μl22.08 μl
5DTT (0.1M)0.5 μl55.2 μl
6Betaine (5M)2 μl220.8 μl
7MgCl2 (1M)0.1 μl11.04 μl
8Template Switching Oligo (100μM)0.2 μl22.08 μl
9dNTPs (25 mM each)0.4 μl44.16 μl
10Nuclease-free water4.1 μl452.64 μl
11Total10 μl1104 μl

ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Superscript II Reverse Transcriptase0.5 μl55.2 μl
3Superscript II RT buffer2 μl220.8 μl
4RNAse inhibitor0.2 μl22.08 μl
5DTT (0.1M)0.5 μl55.2 μl
6Betaine (5M)2 μl220.8 μl
7MgCl2 (1M)0.1 μl11.04 μl
8Template Switching Oligo (100μM)0.2 μl22.08 μl
9dNTPs (25 mM each)0.4 μl44.16 μl
10Nuclease-free water4.1 μl452.64 μl
11Total10 μl1104 μl

Prepare the PCR mix:
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction6-well plate
2KAPA HiFi HotStart Readymix (2x)11 μl1214 μl
3ISPCR primer (10μM)0.3 μl33.12 μl
4H2O0.7 μl77.28 μl
5Total12 μl1324.8 μl

ABC
1Reagent1 reaction6-well plate
2KAPA HiFi HotStart Readymix (2x)11 μl1214 μl
3ISPCR primer (10μM)0.3 μl33.12 μl
4H2O0.7 μl77.28 μl
5Total12 μl1324.8 μl
Spin the beads down gently and resuspend by careful vortexing.

Perform the RT according to the following program:
10 cycles:
------------
------------
When the RT program is almost done, continue with step 25

source.body: To optimize cDNA yield it is recommended to vortex the plate every 20 minutes during the RT program to avoid settling of the beads.

source.description:
Perform PCR according to the following program:
22 cycles:
------------
------------

source.body: This is a good point to interupt the protocol and store the unpurified, amplified cDNA library at -20°C for up to 3 days.

source.description: Place the beads on a magnet and remove the supernatant, then remove the tube from the magnet and resuspend the beads in 60 μl Dynabeads buffer A.
Place the beads on a magnet and remove the supernatant, then remove the tube from the magnet and resuspend the beads in 60 μl Dynabeads buffer B.

Place the Dynabeads on a magnet and remove the supernatant, then remove the tube from the magnet and resuspend the beads in 60 μl Dynabeads 2x binding and washing buffer and 60ul of oligo-dT (100μM).
Prepare the Dynabead resuspension mix during the binding reaction:
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Nuclease-free water1.64 μl188.6 μl
3RNAse inhibitor0.36 μl41.4 μl
4Total2 μl230 μl

source.body: Mix the beads and oligonucleotides well by pipetting up and down

source.title: Incubate beads with oligo-dT at room temperature with agitation

source.description:
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Nuclease-free water1.64 μl188.6 μl
3RNAse inhibitor0.36 μl41.4 μl
4Total2 μl230 μl
Place the Dynabeads on a magnet and remove the supernatant, then remove the tube from the magnet and resuspend the beads in 60 μl Dynabeads 1x binding and washing buffer.
Resuspend the beads in 220 μl of freshly prepared bead resuspension buffer.

source.title: Keep prepared beads on ice until ready to use

source.description:
Prepare the tagmentation mix
ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Tagment DNA buffer (TD)2 μl211.2 μl
3Amplicon Tagmentation mix (ATM)1 μl105.6 μl
4Total3 μl316.8 μl

ABC
1Reagent1 reaction96-well plate
2Tagment DNA buffer (TD)2 μl211.2 μl
3Amplicon Tagmentation mix (ATM)1 μl105.6 μl
4Total3 μl316.8 μl
Pipette 1 μl of each well of the diluted cDNA library (200 pg/μl) plate to the plate with the tagmentation mix and incubate the plate at 55C for 5 minutes.
Add 3 μl of Tagmentation mix to each well of a new 96-well plate. Keep this plate on ice after dispensing the amplicon tagmentation mix.

source.title: Keep tagmentation mix and plate on ice

source.description: Stop the tagmentation reaction and remove the tagmentation complexes from the DNA by adding 1 μl of NT buffer to each well and incubating for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Analyze 1 μl of 11 selected libraries with a Agilent bioanalyzer on a Agilent DNA high-sensitivity chip.
Sequence the NASC-seq library on an Illlumina NextSeq or NovaSeq with standard sequencing primers.

source.body: We recommend sequencing paired-end (2x) 150 cycles to increase the number of conversions that are detected in each read.

source.description: Move plate to magnet and wait up to 5 minutes to immobilize the beads. Remove the supernatant and wash the beads with 50 μl 80% ethanol.
Resuspend beads into 17 μl of nuclease free water and incubate at room temperature for 3 minutes to release DNA.
Move the plate onto the magnet and allow the beads to immobilize for 5 minutes before moving 16 μl of supernatant to a new plate.
Remove the supernatant and dry the beads for 5 minutes.
Analyze 1 μl of the final NASC-seq library on the Agilent Bioanalyzer using a Agilent DNA high sensitivity chip.
Analyze 1 μl of each well of the cDNA library plate by QuantiFluor assay
Use the concentrations measured in step 32 to prepare a plate with cDNA from all libraries diluted to 200 pg/μl.
Add 2 ul of premixed Illumina N7/N5 compatible indexing primers (1 μM) to each well.

Add 3 μl of Illumina PCR mix (NPM) to each well of the plate and perform PCR according to the following conditions:
10 cycles:
------------
------------
Pool 2.5 μl from each well into a new 1.5ml eppendorf tube and transfer 200 μl of the mixed pool to another new eppendorf tube.
Place the beads on a magnet and allow beads to immobilize for 5 minutes. Then transfer the supernatant to a new 1.5ml eppendorf tube.
Add 60 μl of AMPure XP beads to the 300 μl of library and PEG mixture (supernatant from step 44). Mix by pipetting up and down and allow DNA to bind for 15 minutes.
Place the beads on the magnet and allow 5 minutes to immobilize the beads. Remove the supernatant and wash the immobilized beads with 200 μl 80% ethanol. Repeat the ethanol wash 4 times.
Allow the beads to dry for 5 minutes.
Add 100 μl of AMPure XP beads and allow 5 minutes at room temperature to bind very large framgents and exclude them.
Resuspend the beads in 60 μl of nuclease-free water and allow 5 minutes to release the DNA.
Transfer 55 μl of the final resuspended NASC-seq library to a new 1.5ml eppendorf tube and keep it on ice.
Measure the concentration of the final NASC-seq library using the Qubit DNA HS kit and prepare a 4nM final library for sequencing.
Grow cells in the presence of 50 μM 4sU. It can be helpful to collect untreated cells as a control.

source.body:
• 4sU is light-sensitive, and direct light (i.e. light in the cell culture hood, etc) should be reduced to a minimum.
  • Do not refreeze leftovers from 4sU aliquot.
  • Labeling times can vary for different celltypes and biological applications, but in general, short labeling times (i.e. less than 30 minutes) may result in poor performance of the grandSLAM mixture model. Depending on your downstream analysis, this may affect your results.

source.description: Stop the labeling by transferring your cells to 15-ml falcon tubes on ice and wash them with cold PBS.

materials.name: Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit
